@graph.name: Cornbread Muffins - JoyFoodSunshine
@graph.description: The best cornbread muffins! They’re sweet & moist with bursts of fresh corn in every bite. These corn muffins are easy to make in 30 minutes!

@graph.name: Why are my cornbread muffins dry?

acceptedAnswer.text: This recipe makes very moist muffins, if they turn out dry it's likely that they were over-baked. Next time, shorten the baking time and be sure to use an oven thermometer to make sure your oven is heating to the proper temperature.

@graph.name: What kind of cornmeal should I use?

acceptedAnswer.text: This corn muffins recipe calls for yellow cornmeal, but white can be used as well it will just have a different color.

@graph.name: Best Cornbread Muffins Recipe
@graph.description: These are the best cornbread muffins you'll ever eat! They’re sweet and moist with a beautiful crumb, with bursts of fresh corn in every bite. Plus, these corn muffins are easy to make in 30 minutes - no mixer required.

video.name: Best Cornbread Muffins Recipe (From Scratch)
video.description: These are the best cornbread muffins you'll ever eat! They’re sweet and moist with a beautiful crumb, with bursts of fresh corn in every bite. Plus, these corn muffins are easy to make in 30 minutes - no mixer required. Best served slathered with cinnamon honey butter!

recipeIngredient: ¼ cup sour cream (1/2 cup need to figure out which one haha -)
1 cup corn kernels (fresh, or frozen & thawed)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Grease a standard 12-cup muffin tin.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Grease a standard 12-cup muffin tin.

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, combine cornmeal, flour, baking powder, baking soda, and sea salt. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium bowl, combine cornmeal, flour, baking powder, baking soda, and sea salt. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, whisk together melted butter sugar and honey.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, whisk together melted butter sugar and honey.

recipeInstructions.text: Add, milk, sour cream and eggs and whisk until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Add, milk, sour cream and eggs and whisk until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Add dry ingredients and stir/whisk until mixture is smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Add dry ingredients and stir/whisk until mixture is smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Put ¼ cup batter into each well of the prepared muffin tin.
recipeInstructions.name: Put ¼ cup batter into each well of the prepared muffin tin.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 12-15 minutes or until the top is set, lightly golden-brown and a toothpick inserted in the center of the muffins comes out clean.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 12-15 minutes or until the top is set, lightly golden-brown and a toothpick inserted in the center of the muffins comes out clean.

recipeInstructions.text: Let the muffins cool in the pan for 5 minutes. Then transfer them to a wire cooling rack to cool slightly.
recipeInstructions.name: Let the muffins cool in the pan for 5 minutes. Then transfer them to a wire cooling rack to cool slightly.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve warm with butter, cinnamon butter.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve warm with butter, cinnamon butter.
